  "paper_metadata": {
    "title": "Evaluating Tanzania's Productive Social Safety Net (PSSN): Local Economy-Wide Impact Evaluation",
    "matches_expected_title": "YES"
  },
  "program_information": {
    "program_name": "Productive Social Safety Net (PSSN)",
    "country": "United Republic of Tanzania",
    "region": "National",
    "target_population": "Poor and vulnerable households"
  },
  "intervention_components": {
    "component_a_cash_support": {
      "component_a_present": true,
      "cash_support_type": "conditional and unconditional cash transfers",
      "cash_amount": "Variable amounts depending on household characteristics (e.g., TZS 10,000 for basic transfer, TZS 4,000 for child benefit, etc.)",
      "cash_frequency": "Monthly",
      "is_loan_or_credit": "NO",
      "cash_evidence_citation": "All households targeted for the programme receive an unconditional transfer, ensuring a basic level of support. Targeted households with children are eligible for a variable conditional transfer if they fulfil key conditions focused on the use of education and health services. Table 1 reports a summary of the fixed and variable monetary benefits provided by the programme."
    },
    "component_b_assets": {
      "component_b_present": true,
      "assets_provided": ["Public works assets (e.g., irrigation canals, watershed management)", "Skills and technology transfer"],
      "direct_provision": "YES",
      "assets_evidence_citation": "Public Works can contribute to create/rehabilitate assets, such as watershed management and irrigation canals, which are supposed to increase productivity of land for all households in rural areas of the United Republic of Tanzania. Transfer of skills and technology through public works can improve productivity of direct beneficiaries too."
    }
  },
  "study_characteristics": {
    "outcomes_measured": [
      "income/earnings",
      "consumption/expenditure",
      "food security/nutrition",
      "education",
      "health",
      "asset accumulation",
      "poverty reduction",
      "resilience",
      "local economic growth"
    ],
    "outcomes_evidence_citation": "According to the midline evaluation, even after a short period of implementation (2015-2017), the PSSN achieved several objectives: 1) reduction of poverty, increased consumption and food security, investment in better living conditions; 2) increased school enrolment, especially for primary school age children; 3) greater take-up of health services and preventive practices; 4) impact on productive activities and assets, moving away from casual labour to non-farm self-employment."
    ,
    "study_design": "Randomized Impact Evaluation (IE)",
    "design_evidence_citation": "To demonstrate that the PSSN was generating the intended impacts, a randomized impact evaluation (IE) was built into the scale up design (Rosas et al., 2019).",
    "is_review_or_policy_analysis": false,
    "publication_year": null,
    "study_conducted_year": "2015-2017",
    "sample_size": null,
    "completed": true
  },
  "bonus_information": {
    "has_qualitative_components": false,
    "qualitative_methods": [],
    "qualitative_evidence_citation": null,
    "has_cost_data": true,
    "cost_mentions": "The combined cash transfer of TZS 450 billion creates a percentage increase in real local GDP of 3 percent.",
    "cost_evidence_citation": "Under the CCT+PW scenario, a total of TZS 450 million enters the local economy and with a multiplier of 1.56, it generates a total of 702 million of extra real GDP."
  },
  "evidence_citations": {
    "program_name_citation": "TASAF phase III is centred on the Productive Social Safety Net (PSSN), a national social protection programme aimed at creating the building blocks of a comprehensive, efficient, and permanent productive social safety net system for the poor and vulnerable section of the Tanzanian population.",
    "country_citation": "TASAF phase III is centred on the Productive Social Safety Net (PSSN), a national social protection programme aimed at creating the building blocks of a comprehensive, efficient, and permanent productive social safety net system for the poor and vulnerable section of the Tanzanian population.",
    "target_population_citation": "The PSSN aims to increase income and consumption and improve the resilience capacity among vulnerable populations, while strengthening children's human capital."
  }
